definitions: person who breaks or fails to comply with laws, rules, or agreements
examples: The traffic violator received a hefty fine for speeding
Repeat violators face increasingly severe penalties under the new law

definitions: behavior involving physical force intended to hurt, damage, or kill
strength of emotion or unpleasant destructive natural force
examples: Police are investigating several acts of violence in the neighborhood
The violence escalated when protesters clashed with security forces
The violence of the storm destroyed hundreds of coastal homes
She was shocked by the violence of his reaction to criticism

definitions: small plant with purple, blue, or white five-petaled flowers
bluish-purple color seen at the end of the spectrum
examples: She planted violets along the garden path every spring
Wild violets bloom in the forest during early summer
The artist mixed blue and red to create a perfect violet
Her dress was a beautiful shade of deep violet

definitions: wooden stringed instrument played with a bow, held between shoulder and chin
examples: She practiced violin for three hours every day
The orchestra needs two more violins for the performance

definitions: person who plays the violin, especially as a profession
examples: The violinist received a standing ovation after her solo
He worked as a violinist in the city symphony orchestra

definitions: person who plays the viola, a stringed instrument slightly larger than a violin
examples: The violist adjusted her music stand before the performance
As principal violist, he led the viola section expertly

definitions: formal name for cello, a large stringed instrument played upright with a bow
examples: The violoncello produces rich, deep tones in the lower register
Bach's suites for unaccompanied violoncello remain masterpieces today

definitions: venomous snake with large hinged fangs, typically having a broad head
malicious or treacherous person who betrays trust
examples: The hiker spotted a viper coiled on the rocky trail
European vipers are the only venomous snakes in Britain
She discovered her trusted friend was a viper all along
Watch out for vipers in the corporate boardroom

definitions: person who has never had sexual intercourse
something in its original, pure, or untouched state
examples: Medieval culture placed great importance on remaining a virgin until marriage
The couple decided to stay virgins until their wedding night
They explored virgin territory never mapped before by explorers
The company drilled for oil in virgin forests

definitions: state of never having had sexual intercourse or being sexually inexperienced
examples: Different cultures have varying attitudes toward virginity before marriage
She chose to maintain her virginity throughout college

definitions: quality of having strength, energy, and strong sex drive traditionally associated with men
examples: Ancient warriors often displayed symbols of their virility and strength
The aging actor tried desperately to maintain his youthful virility

definitions: scientist who studies viruses and viral diseases
examples: The virologist examined samples under an electron microscope
Leading virologists collaborated to develop the new vaccine

definitions: branch of science that deals with the study of viruses
examples: She earned her doctorate in virology from Harvard University
Modern virology has revolutionized our understanding of infectious diseases

definitions: behavior showing high moral standards and righteousness
good or useful quality or advantage of something
examples: Patience has always been considered an important virtue
The ancient philosophers debated the nature of virtue
The virtue of this approach is its remarkable simplicity
This medicine has the virtue of few side effects

definitions: great skill in music or another artistic pursuit demonstrating technical mastery
examples: The pianist's virtuosity left the audience completely mesmerized
His virtuosity on the guitar earned him international acclaim

definitions: person highly skilled in music or another artistic pursuit
examples: The young virtuoso performed three encores for the delighted crowd
She was recognized as a piano virtuoso by age twelve

definitions: degree of pathogenicity or ability of a microorganism to cause disease
bitter hostility or malevolence in feelings or behavior
examples: Scientists studied the virulence of the new bacterial strain
The virulence of this flu variant concerns health officials
The virulence of his attacks on opponents shocked everyone
Political discourse has increased in virulence recently

definitions: official authorization added to a passport permitting entry into and travel within a particular country
examples: She applied for a tourist visa three months before traveling
His work visa expires at the end of next year

definitions: person's face or facial expression with reference to its features or expression
examples: His stern visage intimidated everyone in the boardroom
The portrait captured her serene visage perfectly

definitions: state of being thick, sticky, and semifluid due to internal friction
examples: Motor oil viscosity changes significantly with temperature variations
The viscosity of honey makes it flow slowly

definitions: British nobleman ranking above a baron and below an earl
examples: The viscount inherited his title from his late father
Viscount Montgomery attended the royal ceremony yesterday

definitions: metal tool with movable jaws used to hold an object firmly in place while work is done on it
examples: He tightened the vise to secure the wood before sawing
The mechanic's vise held the part steady during repairs

definitions: state of being able to see or be seen determined by light and weather conditions
degree to which something has attracted general attention or prominence
examples: Fog reduced visibility to less than fifty meters
Pilots require minimum visibility before attempting to land
The campaign increased the company's visibility in Asian markets
Social media visibility helps artists reach new audiences

definitions: ability to see with the eyes or quality of eyesight
mental image of what the future will or could be like
experience of seeing something in a dream or trance, especially of supernatural nature
examples: Her vision deteriorated significantly after the accident
Regular eye exams help maintain healthy vision
The CEO shared her vision for the company's future
Martin Luther King's vision inspired millions worldwide
The prophet claimed to have visions of coming disasters
She had visions of angels during her near-death experience

definitions: person with original ideas about what the future will or could be like
examples: Steve Jobs was considered a visionary in technology design
The architect's visionary approach transformed urban planning

definitions: act of going to see a person or place socially or as a tourist
official or formal call for inspection or consultation
examples: Their visit to grandparents lasted the entire weekend
Millions of tourists visit Paris every single year
The doctor's visit revealed no serious health concerns
The inspector's visit uncovered several safety violations

definitions: official visit, typically for inspection or supervision
legal right to spend time with one's children in custody arrangements
appearance of a supernatural being or divine manifestation
examples: The school prepares thoroughly for the accreditation visitation
Prison visitation hours are strictly limited on weekdays
The divorce decree grants him weekend visitation with his children
Visitation rights were modified by the family court
Many pilgrims claimed to witness the Virgin Mary's visitation
The church commemorates the Visitation of the Blessed Virgin

definitions: staying somewhere temporarily as a guest or holding a temporary academic or professional position
examples: The visiting professor taught advanced quantum physics this semester
Visiting hours at the hospital end at eight o'clock

definitions: person visiting a place, especially socially or as a tourist
examples: The museum welcomed thousands of visitors during the exhibition
Please sign in at reception if you're a visitor

definitions: movable part of a helmet that protects the face
projecting front part of a cap protecting eyes from sun
examples: The knight lowered his visor before entering battle
The motorcycle helmet's visor protected her from debris
She adjusted her visor to block the afternoon sun
The tennis player wore a visor during the match

definitions: pleasing view, especially one seen through a long, narrow opening
examples: The mountain trail opened onto a breathtaking vista
Their room offered spectacular vistas of the coastline

definitions: formation of a mental image of something not present to sight
representation of data or information in visual form like charts or diagrams
examples: Athletes use visualisation techniques to improve their performance
Guided visualisation helps reduce anxiety before surgery
The data visualisation clearly showed quarterly sales trends
Modern visualisation software makes complex data more accessible

definitions: formation of a mental image of something not present to sight
representation of data or information in visual form like charts or diagrams
examples: Success visualization motivates athletes during training sessions
The therapist taught visualization exercises for pain management
This visualization displays network traffic in real time
Data visualization tools help identify hidden patterns

definitions: state of being strong, active, and energetic with the ability to live and develop
examples: Regular exercise helps maintain vitality throughout aging
The city's economic vitality attracts young professionals

definitions: organic compound required in small quantities for normal growth and metabolic processes
examples: Citrus fruits provide an excellent source of vitamin C
The doctor prescribed vitamin D supplements for winter months

definitions: cruel and bitter criticism or malicious verbal attack
sulfuric acid or a sulfate of metal
examples: Political debates often descend into personal vitriol
The reviewer's vitriol shocked even seasoned critics
Medieval alchemists used vitriol in their experiments
Blue vitriol is another name for copper sulfate

definitions: practice of performing operations on live animals for scientific research or experimentation
examples: Animal rights activists strongly oppose vivisection in laboratories
The debate over vivisection divides the scientific community

definitions: female fox
spirited, quarrelsome, or sexually attractive woman
examples: The vixen led her cubs through the moonlit forest
A vixen's bark echoed across the countryside
Critics called her a vixen for her fierce performances
The character was portrayed as a cunning vixen

definitions: high-ranking political advisor or minister in Muslim countries, especially in historical Ottoman Empire
examples: The sultan's grand vizier wielded enormous political power
Historical records detail the vizier's administrative reforms

definitions: blog featuring videos as the primary content medium rather than text
examples: She posts a new vlog about travel adventures weekly
His daily vlog has attracted millions of subscribers

definitions: body of words used in a particular language or field
range of words known to an individual person
examples: Medical vocabulary requires years of study to master
English vocabulary contains words from many different languages
Reading regularly helps expand your vocabulary significantly
Her vocabulary impressed the university admissions committee

definitions: part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on instruments
examples: The producer isolated the vocals for the remix version
She recorded multiple vocal tracks for the album

definitions: singer, especially in a jazz or rock band
examples: The band auditioned several vocalists before finding the right fit
She worked as a backup vocalist for famous artists

definitions: utterance of sounds, especially by animals, or the act of producing voice
examples: Whale vocalizations can travel thousands of miles underwater
The baby's first vocalizations delighted her parents

definitions: strong feeling of suitability for a particular career or occupation, especially religious
examples: Teaching wasn't just a job but her true vocation
He felt a vocation to serve in the priesthood

definitions: clear distilled alcoholic beverage originating from Russia and Poland
examples: They ordered vodka martinis at the upscale bar
Russian vodka is traditionally served neat and chilled

definitions: prevailing fashion or style at a particular time
examples: Minimalist design came into vogue during the 1990s
That hairstyle was all the vogue last season

definitions: sound produced in speaking or singing through vocal cords
expression of opinions or the right to express them
form of verb indicating relation between subject and action
examples: Her voice carried clearly across the crowded auditorium
The singer lost her voice before the concert
Citizens demanded a voice in government policy decisions
The newspaper gives voice to community concerns
Students learned the difference between active and passive voice
This sentence uses the passive voice construction

definitions: electronic system that records telephone messages when the recipient is unavailable
examples: Please leave a detailed voicemail after the beep
She checked her voicemail for urgent messages

definitions: manner of producing speech sounds using vocal cords
act of expressing opinions or feelings in words
examples: The linguist studied voicing patterns in different languages
Voicing distinguishes 'b' from 'p' in English
Several employees are voicing concerns about the new policy
She's voicing her support for the environmental initiative
